meanings.sent1: I found a duplet of socks in the drawer.
meanings.sent2: The twins always wore matching duplets of shoes.
meanings.sent3: The duplet of kittens played together in the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like a precious duplet of gems.
meanings.sent5: The duplet of lovebirds chirped happily in their cage.

meanings.sent1: We formed a duplet to work on the project together.
meanings.sent2: The teacher divided the class into duplets for the activity.
meanings.sent3: The duplet of friends shared a pizza for lunch.
meanings.sent4: The sun and moon appeared as a celestial duplet in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The duplet of dancers moved in perfect harmony on stage.

meanings.definition: Two items or elements that are similar or identical
meanings.sent1: The artist displayed a duplet of paintings at the gallery.
meanings.sent2: She bought a duplet of earrings to match her necklace.
meanings.sent3: The duplet of keys unlocked the mysterious chest.
meanings.sent4: His words and actions formed a duplet of deception.
meanings.sent5: The duplet of melodies intertwined beautifully in the song.
